intro: Calandrinia corrigioloides, commonly known as the coastal morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California. It is a low-growing, herbaceous annual that produces vibrant pink to purple flowers resembling those of the morning glory genus. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers open in the morning, closing by midday. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal climates with high salinity and strong winds. Calandrinia corrigioloides is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a characteristic species of the California coastal scrub ecosystem.
